intro: Sophia leptostylis, commonly known as the slender-styled sophia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
